Name: Community Medical Center
Description: Part of Community Medical Center (Providence affiliated)
Capital_and_project_history__c:
• $17.9 million investment in a new 19,015 square foot cardiovascular center, announced in March 2023, with construction slated to begin in fall 2023 and completion expected in approximately two years (Source: https://www.communitymed.org/news/2023/03/06/announcing-new-179-million-cardiovascular-building)
• $13.5 million expansion and remodel of the existing Emergency Department, announced in May 2021, with completion expected in early 2022 (Source: https://www.communitymed.org/news/2021/05/03/community-medical-center-breaks-ground-on-135-million-emergency-department)
Debt_appetite_constraints__c:
• Current debt: LifePoint consolidated leverage remains high (S&P cites ~7.1x adjusted leverage in 2025 outlook context following 2024 refinancing), indicating the CMC parent is highly levered. ([alacrastore.com](https://www.alacrastore.com/s-and-p-credit-research/LifePoint-Health-Inc-s-Proposed-1-845-Billion-Term-Loan-B-Rated-B-Recovery-Rating-3-3246922?utm_source=openai))
• Capacity: Incremental secured capacity exists at the corporate level (e.g., 2024 $1.845B TLB refi rated ‘B’), but appetite at the facility level likely constrained; CMC capital has recently been funded via corporate capex rather than local borrowings. ([alacrastore.com](https://www.alacrastore.com/s-and-p-credit-research/LifePoint-Health-Inc-s-Proposed-1-845-Billion-Term-Loan-B-Rated-B-Recovery-Rating-3-3246922?utm_source=openai))
• Recent activity: Corporate debt actions include 2023–2024 note issuances/refinancings; locally, CMC executed $17.9M Heart Center project and recorded ~$18.6M of 2024 capital improvements. ([alacrastore.com](https://www.alacrastore.com/s-and-p-credit-research/LifePoint-Health-Inc-s-Proposed-Senior-Secured-Notes-Rated-B-3027922?utm_source=openai))
General_Company_Description__c: Community Medical Center is a leading healthcare organization in Western Montana, committed to providing personalized care close to home. Founded in 1922, the 151-bed acute care facility offers a wide range of services, including surgical procedures with the da Vinci surgical robot, a Level III trauma center, and comprehensive obstetrical and newborn care with a Level II Neonatal Intensive Care Unit. The center employs over 1,100 individuals and has more than 300 physicians on staff, representing over 38 specialties. Affiliated with Billings Clinic and LifePoint Health, Community Medical Center is dedicated to making communities healthier by offering treatments and technology combined with medical specialties often only available in major cities. The hospital is located on a 45-acre campus in Missoula, Montana, serving patients from Missoula County and surrounding areas. The center is also home to notable programs such as CareFlight, an air ambulance helicopter serving western Montana, and the Montana Heart Center, established in 1999 to provide comprehensive cardiac care to patients in the region.
General_Company_News__c: • Community Medical Center announced plans to develop a new 45,000-square-foot inpatient rehabilitation hospital in Missoula, expected to open in late 2026 or early 2027. The facility will include 40 beds and offer multidisciplinary therapy services for patients recovering from conditions like brain or spinal injuries. ([montanarightnow.com](https://www.montanarightnow.com/missoula/new-inpatient-hospital-for-rehabilitation-coming-to-missoula/article_29d875b2-38ed-11ef-a647-cbec2bcd9809.html?utm_source=openai))
Geographic_footprint__c: ['Missoula County, MT', 'Ravalli County, MT', 'Lake County, MT', 'Western Montana']
Infrastructure_upgrades__c: • Reconstruction of 3,600 linear feet of Stephens Avenue, including a new landscaped center island with street lighting, funded by the Montana Department of Transportation's Community Transportation Enhancement Program (Source: https://pcimontana.com/projects-cat/municipal_site/)
Long_term_financial_outlook__c: Capital Projects: $17.9M Heart Center announced Mar 6, 2023; opened/ribbon‑cutting noted in 2024 report. ~40‑bed freestanding inpatient rehab hospital JV with Providence announced Jul 1, 2024 (target late 2026/early 2027). 2024 capital improvements totaled ~$18.6M (Heart Center, spine robot, HD endoscopes). Overall, continued investment alongside corporate support suggests stable-to-positive local growth despite parent leverage. ([communitymed.org](https://www.communitymed.org/news/2023/03/06/announcing-new-179-million-cardiovascular-building?utm_source=openai))
Past_future_capital_uses__c: • Planned construction of a new 45,000 square foot, 40-bed inpatient rehabilitation hospital in partnership with Providence St. Patrick Hospital, with an estimated opening in late 2026 or early 2027 (Source: https://www.communitymed.org/news/2024/07/01/community-medical-center-and-providence-announce-intention-to-build-new-inpatient-rehabilitation-hospital-in-missoula)
Recent_disclosures__c:
• Sep 9, 2024 Rating/Refinancing: $1.845B Term Loan B – S&P rated LifePoint Health Inc.’s proposed TLB ‘B’ (recovery ‘3’) to refinance existing TLB maturing 2028. ([alacrastore.com](https://www.alacrastore.com/s-and-p-credit-research/LifePoint-Health-Inc-s-Proposed-1-845-Billion-Term-Loan-B-Rated-B-Recovery-Rating-3-3246922?utm_source=openai))
• May 10, 2024 Rating: Senior secured term loan B and proposed unsecured notes for LifePoint – S&P issue-level ratings (‘B’ and ‘CCC+’). ([alacrastore.com](https://www.alacrastore.com/s-and-p-credit-research/LifePoint-Health-Inc-s-Proposed-Senior-Secured-Notes-Rated-B-3027922?utm_source=openai))
• Dec 14, 2023 Rating Update: S&P revised LifePoint Health outlook to Stable; ratings affirmed. ([alacrastore.com](https://www.alacrastore.com/s-and-p-credit-research/Research-Update-LifePoint-Health-Inc-Outlook-Revised-To-Stable-From-Negative-On-Steadily-Improving-Performance-Ratings-Affirmed-3102846?utm_source=openai))
• Sep 29, 2023 Bond Offering: $1.0B senior secured notes for LifePoint Health rated ‘B’ (recovery ‘3’). ([alacrastore.com](https://www.alacrastore.com/s-and-p-credit-research/LifePoint-Health-Inc-s-Proposed-Senior-Secured-Notes-Rated-B-3027922?utm_source=openai))
• Mar 6, 2023 Capital Project: $17.9M cardiovascular building announced by Community Medical Center (CMC). ([communitymed.org](https://www.communitymed.org/news/2023/03/06/announcing-new-179-million-cardiovascular-building?utm_source=openai))
• Jul 1, 2024 Capital Project/JV: CMC and Providence St. Patrick Hospital announced intent to build a 40-bed, ~45,000 sq ft inpatient rehabilitation hospital in Missoula, target opening late 2026/early 2027. ([communitymed.org](https://www.communitymed.org/news/2024/07/01/community-medical-center-and-providence-announce-intention-to-build-new-inpatient-rehabilitation-hospital-in-missoula?query=internal%2525252525252520medicine&utm_source=openai))
• 2024 Community Benefit Report: CMC reports ~$18.6M capital improvements in 2024 (new Heart Center, spine robot, HD endoscopes). ([communitymed.org](https://www.communitymed.org/docs/ahcommunitymedicalcenterlibraries/default-document-library/2024_cbr_community_medical_center_lp_lores.pdf))
Weighted_average_cost_of_capital__c: WACC: 9.5% (Methodology: Treated CMC as a for‑profit subsidiary of LifePoint Health. Used S&P corporate credit context for LifePoint (‘B’ issuer/issue ratings) to anchor cost of debt: secured debt all‑in ~8–9% in 2024; unsecured would be higher. Assume...
Debt__c: Other debt: Limited disclosure available (no public filings show standalone CMC equipment financings, leases, pensions, or conduit bonds in 2023–2024; as a for‑profit affiliate, CMC does not utilize Montana Facility Finance Authority’s nonprofit tax‑exempt conduit programs). ([commerce.mt.gov](https://commerce.mt.gov/Business/Programs-and-Services/Montana-Facility-Finance-Authority/?utm_source=openai))
